text:
Thanks so much Simone that is helpful context! I checked and unfortunately, it is not possible to add a link to the `addAlert`. Only text is allowed in there.

I hear your point about wanting to provide feedback once an action is done. One potential idea: the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/modal|Modal component> could be used as a way to show that a task was successful. This will need the user to explicitly open the Modal but I'm wondering if this might be helpful? I'd love to chat more and it might be good to set up a call to discuss your use case in depth and discuss your feedback. Here's a <https://www.HubSpot.com/meetings/aanchal-sheth/11-meeting-link?uuid=61bf94eb-29cb-4b33-b622-ea9863464bf8|meeting link>

Hi Byron,
Thanks for your question! You should be able to set the maxValue to any number, but it's not possible to have the `showPercentage` label show anything more than 100%. Is that what you're asking?

Can you tell me more about your use case? An example would help us think through options and see if we can do anything on our end
Has anyone done some sort of calendar view with custom cards?

Hey there!

You got it right - essentially we want to display budgets from a third party API. And as we all know, budgets can end up above the anticipated 100% mark. Right now we have to use a workaround to display the % over the budget with a tag, but it would be a lot better if we could show the 132% directly within the ProgressBar.
its a pretty tough problem but you could definitely pull it off with an iframe and react-calendar
with the default components though, it would be pretty hacky
Thats a good idea, thank you <@U01QVR44MEY>. I also think that using the components would be too much since working with dates always brings up challenges.
yeah exactly that date picker has the worst values to deal with
Just wait until we live in an interplanetary system and besides more timezones, we will have calendar zones where some planets have 3 months for example. Nvm lets live the present.

Hi folks, I'm getting an error when trying <https://github.com/HubSpot/uie-beta-public-app-samples|sample> public app. Trying on this account -> 5641059, project -> multi-step-flow
```Couldn't create a REACT_EXTENSION with your file `/app/extensions/multi-step-flow-example-card.json` because you don't have access to this functionality. To learn more and sign up for the beta, contact support.```
^ without `public-app.json` It's working perfect as a private app. Do I need to enable anything for public apps?
